intro: Epipactis pinovica, commonly known as the slender helleborine, is a terrestrial orchid native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its dark green, pleated leaves and a single, showy, greenish-yellow flower with a distinctive lip. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist habitats such as woodlands and meadows. It is a perennial species that thrives in temperate climates. Its flowers bloom from June to August, attracting various pollinators with their nectar.
